description:
Software architecture is often overlooked: pushed by deadlines and
hurry, we tend to make our applications a giant ball of mud. Here is
where the unix philosophy comes to help.

In this talk I will give an overview of the unix philosophy and I will
explain how I have applied it to django development for the
`OpenWISP <http://openwisp.org>`__ and `NetJSON <http://netjson.org/>`__
projects (a set of software modules and standard formats that can be
used to `deploy wireless networks and implement a public wifi
service <http://openwisp.org/whatis.html>`__) with encouraging results.
In this talk I will cover the benefits and the downside of such
approach, showing example implementations that are being tested in the
real world.

`Slides are available on
slideshare <https://www.slideshare.net/FedericoCapoano/applying-the-unix-%20philosophy-to-django-projects-a-report-from-the-real-world>`__.
title: Applying the unix philosophy to django projects: a report from the real world
